item.title: Kogado Studio announces Japanese-style fantasy visual novel Dear Mirror Flower for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/kogado-studio-announces-japanese-style-fantasy-visual-novel-dear-mirror-flower-for-pc

Kogado Studio has announced Dear Mirror Flower, a Japanese-style fantasy visual novel set in a town where strange incidents never cease. It will launch for PC via Steam on June 20 worldwide with English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

I am here, in this world…

A Japanese-style fantasy adventure by Kogado Studio.

In this town, strange incidents never cease. The cause? Beings born from the darkness of the human heart: Demon Spirits. Join Satoree Mizuki, a girl who can read others’ minds, and uncover the truth behind these supernatural cases.

Story

…I can’t remember anything.

Through the haze of my fading consciousness, a girl’s voice faintly echoes in my ears.

When I open my eyes, I find her staring at me, her face filled with uncertainty.

According to her, this town is plagued by Demon Spirits, creatures that lurk in the shadows, bringing disaster to those who cross their path.

And one of them… stole my memories.

With the guidance of this girl, I step into a world of exorcism and supernatural battles without a single clue about my identity.

  • ❮
  • ❯

System

The protagonist, Yuto Kamizuki, is a Kotodama User whose words can shape reality.

Harness the power of Kotodama and exorcise Demon Spirits alongside Satoree Mizuki.

Staff

  • Production: Kogado Studio, Inc.
  • Planning: Kawasyonin49
  • Character Design: Herigaru, Ringopann
  • Programming: Noguchi Ryukei, Hinata Anan, Funayama Kazuma
  • Theme Song
    • Title: “Kagami No Hanasaku Tsukiyo”
    • Singer: Raito & Yagatechi Bayashi feat. Abe Rika
    • Copyright: Lisa-rec, Inc.
